author: TranNgocKhoa
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).

-->

# Steps to reproduce
1. Open PowerShell in Windows Explorer Context (Right click >> Open PowerShell)
2. Wait and then Type command

# Expected behavior
PowerShell display text immedialy


# Actual behavior
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30297271/50524972-59c2df80-0b0b-11e9-828d-36102c5c7e80.png)



# Environment data
PowerShell 6.2.0-preview.3
Windows 10 build 18305.
SSD 256GB SATA3.
16GB RAM
Intel Core I5 4200H
<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

comments.author: kvprasoon
comments.body: What version of pwsh are you using ? Didn't get you with the step you have opened PowerShell, can you open it via `Run (Windows key + R)` -> `pwsh`

comments.author: TranNgocKhoa
comments.body: I updated issue. I use PowerShell 6.2.0-preview.3

comments.author: kvprasoon
comments.body: I cannot reproduce. Is the command execution takes more time or not at all executing ?

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
I've seen things like this occurs in the VS Code integrated console, but never in the pwsh console itself.

Do you have anything in your PowerShell profile scripts?

comments.author: TranNgocKhoa
comments.body:
> Do you have anything in your PowerShell profile scripts

Sorry, I don't understand what you mean....



> Is the command execution takes more time or not at all executing

When I try to _Right click >> Open PowerShell_ in Windows Explorer, it take quite long time and as you see, there is no text displayed here.
I think affter excute command `ls`, PowerShell does response but it can't display any text.

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
Is this display issue also present when you start pwsh in other ways?

Run `get-content $profile` to see if there is anything in your profile script.

comments.author: TranNgocKhoa
comments.body:
> Is this display issue also present when you start pwsh in other ways?

If I run PowerShell by normal way like click on pwsh.exe, or shortcut, it runs properly.



> Run `get-content $profile` to see if there is anything in your profile script.

I try your command and this is the result
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30297271/50545209-ec17d000-0c3e-11e9-9f7f-2db7a888edcd.png)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: It seems @TranNgocKhoa is using the Context Menu integration option in the MSI installer.  I don't see this problem on my Win10 machine.

comments.author: kvprasoon
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT  Even with context menu integration, will there be any behavioural difference as its invoking same pwsh.exe ?

comments.author: TranNgocKhoa
comments.body:
> It seems @TranNgocKhoa is using the Context Menu integration option in the MSI installer. I don't see this problem on my Win10 machine.

And I don't know why but PS is booting quite slow.  I have to wait for 2 - 5s until everything finish.
I use SSD for Disk C and with other machine that uses HDD, it's even slower.

comments.author: kvprasoon
comments.body: The start time issue is tracked with #6443 . @SteveL-MSFT can you confirm and update the progress for us ?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
TranNgocKhoa
comments.body:
> As for the context menu, the difference is the command line [arguments used](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/assets/Product.wxs#L210) to start pwsh. Otherwise it should be the same.

What should I do for now?
Is there any solution for it or should I wait for next release?

comments.author: kvprasoon
comments.body:
Try below,

Take a backup of command folder at 
`HKCR\Computer\HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Directory\ContextMenus\PowerShell6-previewx64\shell\openpwsh\command`
and change the `Default` key value to `C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6-preview\pwsh.exe -NoExit`

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @TranNgocKhoa if you uninstall PSCore6 and reinstall, does the problem still repro for you?

comments.author: TranNgocKhoa
comments.body:
> @TranNgocKhoa if you uninstall PSCore6 and reinstall, does the problem still repro for you?

No, problem still there

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: What antivirus do you use? Try after removing it.

comments.author: TranNgocKhoa
comments.body:
> What antivirus do you use? Try after removing it.

I use Windows Defender. I think it doesn't cause the problem.

comments.author: TranNgocKhoa
comments.body: Hello there... I'm stucking in this issue.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: We can not repo. Exact steps are needed to reproduce the problem. Could you repo on fresh installed OS?

comments.author: TranNgocKhoa
comments.body: I just uninstall PowerShell 6.2.0-preview.3 and reinstall version 6.11 and It works.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @TranNgocKhoa if you reinstall 6.2.0-preview.3 does it work?

comments.author: TranNgocKhoa
comments.body:
> @TranNgocKhoa if you reinstall 6.2.0-preview.3 does it work?

@SteveL-MSFT No, I uninstalled 6.11 then installed 6.20 preview3. It doesn't work.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @TranNgocKhoa 6.1.x and 6.2.x-preview can be installed side-by-side, so you don't need to uninstall 6.1.1 to try 6.2-preview.  Without understanding why this is affecting you, there's no action we can take to fix this since it's not reproing for anyone else right now.

title: PowerShell Core doesn't display text
